meanings.sent1: Her photosensitivity made it difficult for her to spend time outdoors during the day.
meanings.sent2: His photosensitivity meant he always wore sunglasses when outside.
meanings.sent3: The photosensitivity of the vampire was a running joke among his friends.
meanings.sent4: The photosensitivity of the camera captured the vibrant colors of the sunset.
meanings.sent5: The photosensitivity of the film allowed for stunning black and white photographs.

meanings.definition: The quality of being sensitive to light.
meanings.sent1: The doctor explained that her photosensitivity was a result of a medical condition.
meanings.sent2: The photosensitivity of the fabric made it perfect for protecting against UV rays.
meanings.sent3: His photosensitivity was so extreme that he glowed in the dark like a firefly.
meanings.sent4: The photosensitivity of the artist's eyes allowed her to see colors others couldn't.
meanings.sent5: The photosensitivity of the skin was a constant concern for those living in sunny climates.
